meanings.definition: A dark area or shape produced by a body coming between rays of light and a surface.
meanings.sent1: The tree cast long shadows in the evening sun.
meanings.sent2: She saw her shadow on the ground as she walked.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat pounced on its own shadow, thinking it was a rival.
meanings.sent4: In the depths of the forest, the shadows seemed to dance with a life of their own.
meanings.sent5: The shadow of the mountain loomed over the small village, signaling the approach of night.

meanings.definition: A position of relative inferiority or obscurity.
meanings.sent1: He always stayed in the shadows, avoiding the spotlight.
meanings.sent2: The new intern preferred to work in the shadows, observing quietly.
meanings.sent3: The shy student felt more comfortable in the shadows of the classroom.
meanings.sent4: Her talent remained hidden in the shadows until the talent show.
meanings.sent5: The forgotten hero emerged from the shadows to save the day.

meanings.definition: To follow and observe (someone) closely and secretly.
meanings.sent1: The detective shadows the suspect to gather evidence.
meanings.sent2: She decided to shadow her favorite author for a day.
meanings.sent3: The curious child tried to shadow his older sibling everywhere.
meanings.sent4: The spy was tasked to shadow the diplomat during the secret meeting.
meanings.sent5: The paparazzi attempted to shadow the celebrity without being noticed.
